--- In rest-discu=
ss@yahoogroups.com, Mike Kelly <mikekelly321@...> wrote:
>
> On Tue, Apr 3,=
 2012 at 1:53 PM, Barry Norton <barrynorton@...> wrote:
> >
> > I didn't th=
ink that REST was such a house of cards it couldn't accommodate
> > this di=
stinction. Is that the general opinion?
> >
> 
> No. REST is robust enough =
that it can deal with the ambiguities
> inherent to the web (and reality) a=
nd does not have to demand insane
> kludges just to get its house of cards =
erected in the first place.
> Unlike RDF. Hence the creation of range-14.
>=
